author: juneb
body:
Fix for #2041 Added OutputType attribute to Get-ComputerInfo. 

I'm pretty confident about the Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.ComputerInfo object, but please check syntax for PSCustomObject. SMA is included, but this isn't resolving in Visual Studio.

comments.author: msftclas
comments.body:
Hi **@juneb**, I'm your friendly neighborhood Microsoft Pull Request Bot (You can call me MSBOT). Thanks for your contribution! You've already signed the contribution license agreement. Thanks!

The agreement was validated by Microsoft and real humans are currently evaluating your PR.

TTYL, MSBOT;

comments.author: juneb
comments.body:
Thanks, Dongbo! Why do we call the typeof method instead of just providing the full/partial type name? It's getting something dynamically, but I'm not sure how it differs from the static type name in this case.
e.g. 
[OutputType(Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.ComputerInfo, System.Management.Automation.PSObject)]
[OutputType(ComputerInfo, PSObject)]

comments.author: juneb
comments.body: I think this is correct. If you need me to rebase or whatever, please let me know. Thanks for the help.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
If using `public PSTypeName(string name)`, powershell needs to resolve the type name to get the actual type. Using `public PSTypeName(Type type)` would save the effort to resolve the type.

Don't worry about the rebase, I can squash it when merging. Thanks June!

title: Add missing OutputType attribute.
